dtliExcerpt: The show's charm lies in its simplicity and the impressive vocal arrangements that turn everyday subway sounds into music. It's a sweet, small-scale musical that knows exactly what it is.
bwwExcerpt: I can't square the musical sophistication of In Transit with its narrative hackwork. Kathleen Marshall's staging, with its let's-get-past-it rather than the let's-explore-it approach, doesn't help: It's definitely an express. (Even so, the show is a bit too long at 100 minutes without intermission.....

wrongFullText:
The organization will present ”I Am My Own Wife” and two other productions.

Chicago's About Face Theatre has announced its 2016-17 season.

The season kicks off November 4-December 10 with Doug Wright's I Am My Own Wife, directed by Andrew Volkoff. The production will star transgender actress Delia Kropp and two other performers.

Next up is Jon Maran's drama The Temperamentals, running January 13-Feburary 18. The season concludes with Tanya Barfield's Bright Half Life, May 26-July 1. Keira Fromm directs the production, which features Elizabeth Ledo.

Further casting and information about each production will be released in the coming months.

For tickets to About Face Theatre's season, click here.
